page.title: 08LIFE STYLES IN CH. MINSHULL
page.content: A sample of fifty families reveals that many traditional patterns prevail {Men}tend to see to the{garden, the car {and household repairs}while{cooking, {cleaning and child care}remain largely the{woman's}job. 50% of the people questioned grow some of their food. Many do a substantial amount of home baking,knitting and dressmaking. 75% often do their own decorating and routine maintenance jobs. Regular paid domestic help is confined to 8% of families.Families tend to eat together and the{main meal}is between 5 and 6 in the evening. Roast beef,yorkshire pudding and roast potatoes constitute the{favourite meal.}Baked beans and egg and chips are the most common {standby.} 50% of families own at least one{dog} and 75% at least one{cat.}Two of each is not uncommon.
